Class GameRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.GameRenderer
public class GameRenderer extends Object
Handles the graphical rendering of the game state onto the JavaFX scene.

This class acts as the View component in the MVC architecture. It is responsible for:

  • Drawing the main game grid and the static background blocks.
  • Rendering the active falling piece and its "Ghost" projection.
  • Displaying the queue of upcoming bricks.
  • Displaying the currently held brick.

It uses the ColorManager to determine the visual style of each block ID.

    • GameRenderer

      public GameRenderer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.VBox nextBricksContainer, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane holdBrickPanel, ColorManager colorManager)
      Constructs a new GameRenderer.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - the JavaFX grid for the main board
      nextBricksContainer - the VBox to hold next piece previews
      holdBrickPanel - the grid for the hold piece
      colorManager - the manager providing color definitions

  • Method Details

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix)
      Initializes the grid of Rectangle objects for the game view.

      This creates the scene graph nodes (Rectangles) once at startup to avoid object creation overhead during the game loop. It sets up layers for the background, ghost piece, and active piece.

      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the initial state of the board (used to size the grid)

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick)
      Redraws the dynamic elements of the game (Active Piece, Ghost Piece, Next/Hold queues). This is called every frame or whenever the board state changes.
      Parameters:
      brick - the current snapshot of the game state (ViewData)

    • refreshUpcomingBricks

      public void refreshUpcomingBricks(ViewData brick)
      Updates the "Next Pieces" sidebar.
      Parameters:
      brick - the current game state containing the list of upcoming bricks

    • refreshHoldBrick

      public void refreshHoldBrick(ViewData brick)
      Updates the "Hold" panel with the currently held brick.
      Parameters:
      brick - the current game state containing the hold brick data

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Updates the static background grid (locked blocks).
      Parameters:
      board - the matrix of locked blocks

    • setRectangleData

      private void setRectangleData(int color, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Sets the color of a specific grid cell based on its value.
